images.copyright: Mount Segla, Senja Island, Troms og Finnmark, Norway (© imageBROKER/Moritz Wolf/Getty Images)
images.title: A digital creation? Nor-way!
images.caption: Mount Segla, Senja Island, Norway
images.desc: A beautiful island popularly known as 'Norway in miniature,' Senja's diverse landscape boasts mountainous terrain as well as lush greenery. At 600 square miles, it is Norway's second-largest island, connected to the mainland by the Gisund Bridge. The most notable spot on Senja is pictured today, Mount Segla, a magnificent peak that is visited frequently in summer, with a trail starting in Fjordgård, a fishing village in the north of Senja. It's a tough hike to the top, more than 2,000 feet above sea level. Other tourist attractions include Ånderdalen National Park and Tranøya, an island off the south coast of Senja known for its tranquility.
